intro: Aegilops aucheri var. vellea, commonly known as the Persian grass or vellea wheatgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, often blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Aegilops aucheri var. vellea is also of interest in botanical studies for its potential in agricultural and genetic research.
